page.title: 11The Rector
page.content: The Rev. Guy Bookless became Vicar of Willoughby and Wysall and priest in charge of Widmerpool in 1978. The first two have formed a joint living for 150 years. This year Widmerpool (which has a rector) officially be- came linked to the other two; because the title Rector takes precedence over that of Vicar, the parish priest has just become a Rector! He is forgoing an installation because he retires on 5th November; he will live in Lough- borough. He spent time in Harlow, St. Albans and India during his ministry. His wife is a deaconess and helps run the Sunday Schools, runs the Mothers Union and undertakes the lay training for women as well as assisting with other church activities. The vicarage is in Wysall and is fairly modern, the old vicarage having been sold as it is too large and inconvenient.
